data.title: Support to copy content in pages from integrated terminal window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Execute a code(E.g.: Python) in terminal which its output more than 1 page
2. Because selection limitation, It only could copy the content in the current page, the selection is cleared when down/up page by mouse

Expectation:
step2, Refer to windows command line, the selection should not be cleared when down/up page by mouse

data.title: Install rpm deps with correct bitness
data.body: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13544 introduces libXss.so.1 as a dependency to the rpm package, this installs both 32-bit and 64-bit packages which is less than ideal. We should include only he necessary one in the build step.

data.title: Uninstall extension goes back to previous version
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6
1. Get Vim extension at 0.3
2. Updating it to 0.3.7
3. Uninstalling it, it goes back to 0.3. Instead should have removed Vim extension altogether.

This is caused by when upgrading packages VSCode doesn't clean up previous versions of the same extension. 

``` bash
Code > ls ~/.vscode/extensions
vscodevim.vim-0.3.0  vscodevim.vim-0.3.7
```

Other problem is for example :
When i place breakpoint on https://github.com/shanalikhan/code-settings-sync/blob/master/src/extension.ts#L75

It shows the variables are undefined but when i run the above line again that variables gets initialized and works in the console, but at the time of debug when the breakpoint hits variables shows undefined when mouse hover and debug console.

data.title: Allow to open multiple files from file quick open
data.body:
When I open Go To File (typically with Ctrl-P), I'm presented with a list of files (fuzzy filtered by the characters I type if applicable). I can arrow through the list and press Enter to open the file.

What I'd like to be able to do is Shift-Arrow to select multiple files and then press Enter to open _all_ of them.

Here's my use case: I want to add code/functionality to an existing file while also adding tests to it's corresponding test file. The code file and test file both have nearly identical names (the test file typically having `.spec` in the file name), and so are conveniently listed at the top of the list when I enter characters into the fuzzy filter. However, since I can only open a single file, I have to repeat the entire process to open both files.

Shift-Arrow selection would eliminate the issue and improve the workflow. (Reusing the existing principles of multi-select, such as discontinuous selection with Ctrl-Space, would be nice, but is not required.)
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 (and presumably earlier)
- OS Version: Windows 7 (and presumably all others)

data.title: Quote matching when writing a comment (JavaScript)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:28:55.412Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0
- Extensions: PaulOlteanu.theme-railscasts-1.0.0, bogdan-sinitsa.theme-dark-monokai-0.3.0, designbright.theme-suicidesquad-0.1.0, donjayamanne.githistory-0.1.0, humao.rest-client-0.8.5, msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-1.1.0, qinjia.seti-icons-0.1.1, vscodevim.vim-0.3.7, vuhrmeister.vscode-meteor-0.1.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a JavaScript File
2. Start writing a comment (either single-line with `//` or multi-line with `/*`
3. Type a single quote: `'`

The single quote will be duplicated because of the quote matching feature. This should not happen when writing a comment (so you can write proper english 😄)

7. Verify that version has not changed

data.title: Extensions getting corrupt
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

It appears this started to happen on 10/6/2016. I have had some odd behavior occur to some of my extensions, and it appears at least one was corrupt in the process. Old versions of extensions are some how partially getting installed or having something odd go on with them. Here is an example of an extension.
- New Version: EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.3 - Folder Modified 10/6/2016 at 3:00 PM (File Contents all say last modified 9/29/2016 2:32 PM)
- Old Version: EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.1 - Folder Modified 10/6/2016 at 3:05 PM

This Extension is broken and you get errors about `EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.1\package.json` failing to be read and `EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.3/out/src/editorConfigMain` unable to be activated because it is missing. What is odd about this, is the directory `EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.3` shows modified 10/6/2016 at 3:05 PM, but the contents show 9/29/2016 at 2:32 PM, which makes sense to me since the extension was update 9/24. So it appears that the extension was some how broken after it was already installed. It is missing the `out` directory, but if I look in `EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.1` it only has `Node_Modules` and `out`  directories.

This is the only module that appears to have fully broken, but I have about 8 total that error that have files dated 10/6/2016 at 3:05 PM. The old version directories only have a couple directories left in them, like `Node_Modules` and `out` or `Node_Modules` and `dist` or `file-types` and `lib` etc, so Code errors when it can't find the `package.json`

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  "extensions.autoUpdate": true
2.  "window.reopenFolders": "all"

data.title: Unable to Get Local issuer Certificate
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set up Team Foundation Server with Git
2. Manage repos using Git in VSCode 

This has always worked, but today whenever I open VSCode I get this message: 

> Error:  unable to get local issuer certificate

And when I try syncing any of my repos: 

> Error: Authentication failed on the git remote.

I tried running `git config --global credential.helper wincred` but this does nothing.
#### My config file:

```
[credential]
    helper = store
```

I am still able to use git perfectly with Visual Studio 2015 (with the same TFS server)

---

What steps can I take to find the problem?

data.title: Bad API config documentation
data.body:
Here's the [documentation for `vscode.workspace.getConfiguration`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/760b880ee486359ef1aa0e398d5056c6055d87f0/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3840):

```
         * When a section-identifier is provided only that part of the configuration
         * is returned. Dots in the section-identifier are interpreted as child-access,
         * like `{ myExt: { setting: { doIt: true }}}` and `getConfiguration('myExt.setting.doIt') === true`.
```

The snippet `getConfiguration('myExt.setting.doIt') === true` is impossible, since `getConfiguration()` returns something of the `WorkspaceConfiguration` type.

The real snippet which matches the implementation should be: `getConfiguration('myExt.setting').get('doId') === true`.

data.title: "Path must be a string. Received null" in Git view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:28:55.412Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project that's using Git
2. Make change to some file + save
3. Open Git view
4. Click on the file with changes to view diff

Prompted with this error message: `Path must be a string. Received null`.

I started to get these prompts after the latest update. Doesn't happen with all my projects, just some.

data.title: VS Code not reading jsconfig.json
data.body:
I also have the issue the jsconfig.json is not being read (see old/closed issue #703)

Tested with Visual Studio Code v1.5.3 and v1.7.0 insider, on Windows x64 (version 1607). No 3rd party antivirus, just Windows defender.

When using Sysinternals process monitor, I see that VS Code is getting some information about jsconfig.json (QueryAllInformationFile), but does NOT read the file (ReadFile).

Log when opening VS Code (with the current project) (reduced to jsconfig.json and my test file)

http://pastebin.com/GTKHPCZC

Log when actually opening jsconfig.json inside VS Code (so something like that should also happen when launching VS Code):

http://pastebin.com/je8Y3p4C

Not reading jsconfig.json unfortunately means that "go to definition" doesn't work for me with my own js files, what hinders me from switching from Netbeans to VS Code :(

I would really appreciate if this issue could be fixed. If you need further information, or my stripped down example, just let me know!

data.title: [css] Need to remove old CSS grid syntax and add new syntax

data.body:

- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. type some CSS grid properties. 
2. look at suggestions and look at linter

Linter is displaying "unknown property" for valid CSS grid syntax. Autocomplete suggestions only show old syntax( which should be removed)

You can find the syntax here:

data.title: Renaming property with space
data.body:
``` ts
interface Test {
    "alpha beta": string
}

const a : Test = {
    "alpha beta": "test"
}
```

Put cursor inside `beta` of interface and rename with F2

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/19276731/574b9eba-8fa5-11e6-855a-6dc10a0d29f1.png)

Box to rename shows only `beta` - shall it show `alpha beta` ?

Rename to `beta2`

Result:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/19276764/73d7bafa-8fa5-11e6-9f84-f3cab654002f.png)

Should be `alpha beta2`

https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/11531

data.title: Very frequently getting this error: Failed to save '....': The content on disk is newer. Click on Compare to compare your version with the one on disk.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:28:55.412Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open vscode
2. Open a folder on a samba shared folder
3. Edit a file and save

I am getting this error about %70 percent of time when I try editing a file on my samba shared drive (drive is on a Raspberry Pi). No one else is using my drive, content on disk cannot be newer. How do I get rid of this error?

data.title: Format javascript code with shift+alt+f adds new blank lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:37:40.189Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: alefragnani.project-manager-0.10.0, dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.7, donjayamanne.githistory-0.1.0, DotJoshJohnson.xml-1.6.0, eg2.vscode-npm-script-0.0.20, HookyQR.beautify-0.4.0, humao.rest-client-0.8.5, ms-vscode.cpptools-0.9.2, msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-1.1.0, sandy081.todotasks-0.4.0, waderyan.gitblame-1.3.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open vs code
2. Open javascript file
3. Press format code (shift+alt+f)

In my vs code editor each line (LF) will have additional blank line after pressing these buttons. If i have 10 lines before, i have 20 lines after

data.title: Does Code support the engine `>= 1.0.0` syntax?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607, Arch Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try to install any extension with older dependency string (i.e. [x86 and x86_64 Assembly](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/13xforever.language-x86-64-assembly) before 2.2.7) ([package.json](https://github.com/13xforever/x86_64-assembly-vscode/blob/master/package.json#L9))

Observations:
- Everything worked before updating VS Code to 1.6.0
- Installing local .vsix works just fine
- Only changing the engine dependency from `'>=1.0.0` to `^1.0.0` seem to work; this is not intuitive or obvious in any way
- [Linked issue for my package](https://github.com/13xforever/x86-assembly-textmate-bundle/issues/5#issuecomment-253168729)

data.title: Grunt build error when using integrated terminal (Git Bash)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise (Service Pack 1)
- Git Bash Version: GNU bash, version 4.3.42(3)-release (x86_64-pc-msys)
- Node Version: 4.2.2

Hi,

I've recently begun to experience an issue with my Grunt build when executing through the integrated terminal.  I can't pinpoint exactly when the issue started occurring, but it was prior to the latest build - possibly from 1.5.

Our build is pretty complex and highly modular, so it would prove difficult to list it all out here.  I don't think it's particularly relevant at this stage, but I know it could prove useful.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VS code and run the Grunt build without making any changes, it completes successfully. 
2. Make a change to a module, for example a scss partial. 
3. Re-run the build and encounter one of the following errors:

```
Running "requirejs:hub2" (requirejs) task                                                                                                                  
{ [Error: Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, stat 'C:\development\projects\wdp-versionable\cluster\external\hub2\scripts\facades']                     
  originalError:                                                                                                                                           
   { [Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, stat 'C:\development\projects\wdp-versionable\cluster\external\hub2\scripts\facades']                         
     errno: -4048,                                                                                                                                         
     code: 'EPERM',                                                                                                                                        
     syscall: 'stat',                                                                                                                                      
     path: 'C:\\development\\projects\\wdp-versionable\\cluster\\external\\hub2\\scripts\\facades' } } 
```

**OR**

```
Running "requirejs:hub2" (requirejs) task                                                                                                                  
{ [Error: Error: ENOTEMPTY: directory not empty, rmdir 'C:\development\projects\wdp-versionable\cluster\external\hub2\scripts']                            
  originalError:                                                                                                                                           
   { [Error: ENOTEMPTY: directory not empty, rmdir 'C:\development\projects\wdp-versionable\cluster\external\hub2\scripts']                                
     errno: -4051,                                                                                                                                         
     code: 'ENOTEMPTY',                                                                                                                                    
     syscall: 'rmdir',                                                                                                                                     
     path: 'C:\\development\\projects\\wdp-versionable\\cluster\\external\\hub2\\scripts' } }
```

![integrated-terminal-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5471026/19306529/0858be86-906e-11e6-8711-e29a9f600baf.PNG)
1. Attempting to run the build outside of VS Code, in Git Bash also then leads to one of the same errors being thrown.
2. Tried killing the terminal session in VS Code, opening up a new one and running the build again.  This leads to same error.
3. Close VS Code and run the build externally in Git Bash - Build **completes successfully**
